content.description: Go in the chimney and climb the wide crack on the left side. Once at the roof traverse left. This is a very reachy move but protects well. Ascend up left after the roof and use the Powerage anchor. Cool climb but it eats ropes after exiting the roof on the left side. Be prepared to self rescue to get your rope out. It is good short climb but quite dirty on the horizontal crack as no one climbs it.
content.location: Start in the chimney on the left side. This is the route immediately right of the start of Powerage.

content.description: Climb the wide crack in the back left side of the chimney. There is a double crack system but the crack on the right is so dirty don't even try to use it unless you want to clean it first. Go right around the roof and up to a bolt anchor.
content.protection: Rack to #4 C4. Doubles in hand size.
content.location: Start in the back of the chimney. There is a 5.10a variation that starts outside of the chimney on the wall to the right.

content.description: This delicate and somewhat sporty climb is found on the far right of the main wall at the perch.  Climb the discontinuous crack around a bulge and to the top of the climb.
content.protection: Mainly fingers. A small offset is necessary (smallest) to adequately protect the last mantle.
content.location: Right edge of the main wall.

content.description: bomber(now that its clean again) Hands and fists work you up to a couple deep finger moves to pull the bulge. WO.
content.protection: gear to 3.5" with a Mellow WO.
content.location:
5' to the right of Unauthorized transmission up the gully

to the left of Butternut Pearl down in the gully..

content.description: Getting into this fist crack through the roof is the  crux of this crack.  Its strenuous, but no more than the 9+ rating.
content.protection: #3 and #4 cams protect the bottom (crux).  Up high finger sized gear will suffice.  I did use two #4s but singles through #4 would work.  Its only 50' long.
content.location: Apparant fist crack through the longest portion of the cliff.

content.description: Easiest route up The Perch. An offwidth that doesn't require much offwidth technique.
content.protection: Doubles 2"-3 or 3.5." Its pretty short. It'll probably take some smaller gear on the left side.  Shares a bolted anchor with Fist and Shout.
content.location: Starts on top of the boulder in the middle of The Perch area.
